com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.engine.optimizer.core
Class ConnectedGraph

java.lang.Object
  com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.engine.optimizer.core.ConnectedGraph

public class ConnectedGraph
extends java.lang.Object

The class implements a connected graph, i.e. a component of the BasicPatternGraph, and the abstract optimization logic based on node and edge costs.

Author:
Markus Stocker

Constructor Detail

ConnectedGraph

public ConnectedGraph()
Method Detail

optimize

public BasicPattern optimize()
Optimize a connected graph according to our BasicGraphPattern optimization approach.

Returns:
BasicPattern

createNode

public GraphNode createNode(com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple,
                            double weight)
The method allows to allocate a new node for the graph. The node stores the corresponding triple pattern and the weight calculated by the selected heuristic.

Parameters:
triple -
weight -
Returns:
GraphNode

createEdge

public GraphEdge createEdge(GraphNode node1,
                            GraphNode node2,
                            double weight)
The method allows to allocate a new edge for the graph. An edge is described by its corresponding nodes and the weight calculated by the selected heuristic. Please note that to allocate a new edge, it is required that the corresponding nodes are previously allocated.

Parameters:
node1 -
node2 -
weight -
Returns:
GraphEdge

getNodeByOID

public GraphNode getNodeByOID(java.lang.Integer oid)
The method allows a retrieval of a GraphNode, a specific node of the ConnectedGraph by OID lookup.

Parameters:
oid -
Returns:
GraphNode

getEdgeByOID

public GraphEdge getEdgeByOID(java.lang.Integer oid)
The method allows a retrieval of a GraphEdge, a specific edge of the ConnectedGraph by OID lookup. Please note that the OID of an edge is modeled as the multiplication of the OIDs of the corresponding nodes.

Parameters:
oid -
Returns:
GraphEdge

getNodeByTriple

public GraphNode getNodeByTriple(com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple)
The method allows a retrieval of a GraphNode, a specific node of the ConnectedGraph by the triple which corresponds to the node. Internally, the method uses an inverted hash index which maps triple hash codes to the corresponding OID to efficiently retrieve the OID given a triple.

Parameters:
triple -
Returns:
GraphNode

getEdgeByTriples

public GraphEdge getEdgeByTriples(com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple1,
                                  com.hp.hpl.jena.graph.Triple triple2)
The method allows a retrieval of a GraphEdge, a specific edge of the ConnectedGraph by given the two triples which correspond to the nodes of the edge.

Parameters:
triple1 -
triple2 -
Returns:
GraphEdge

getNodes

public java.util.List getNodes()
The method returns the List of the nodes defined for the ConnectedGraph. Note that the list is ordered by the OID, i.e. by the sequence the nodes were added to the connected graph. This is for convenience only (i.e. for testing purposes). In fact, the set of nodes of a graph is defined as unordered.

Returns:
List

getEdges

public java.util.List getEdges()
The method returns the List of the edges defined for the ConnectedGraph. Node that the list is ordered by the OID, i.e. by the sequence the edges were added to the connected graph. This is for conveniece only. In fact, the set of edges of a graph is defined as unordered.

Returns:
List

getOptGraphNodeList

public java.util.Set getOptGraphNodeList()
Return the optimized list of GraphNode objects, i.e. the Query Execution Plan. The method returns null if the ConnectedGraph is not yet optimized, i.e. the method optimize() is not yet executed.

Returns:
Set

getOptGraphEdgeList

public java.util.Set getOptGraphEdgeList()
Return the optimized list of GraphEdge objects, The method returns null if the ConnectedGraph is not yet optimized, i.e. the method optimize() is not yet executed.

Returns:
Set
